title: Along the Amber Route
description: Shortlisted for the Stanford Dolman Award 2021Shortlisted for the Bookmark Book Festival’s Book of the Year Award 2020Longlisted for the Wingate Award 2021Light, portable and high in value, amber is an ideal commodity for long-distance trade. An Amber Route, comparable to the Silk Road, ran from the Baltic to the Mediterranean for thousands of years.C.J. Schüler followed this route by bus, train and boat for 2,500 kilometres along river valleys, forest paths and Roman roads. His journey traces both the greatest fault lines of European geopolitics and his own family’s history. As he explores lands contested by Romans and Vandals, Teutons and Slavs, lost empires andthe former Iron Curtain, Schüler must also confront his own family history, Nazism and the Holocaust.
author: C.J. Schüler
